ProjectTitle: Hyperspectral imaging for online anomaly detection.
InitialFeedbackHistory:
09/06/2022
2. Data description: please include (biological) samples in data table, indicate their origin (plant, animal) and explain whether and how these will be stored/preserved under 5 and 6.
5,6. Storage and preservation: data storage on hard drives is risky, it is recommended to contact your local IT team to discus alternatives such as using the large volume storage, archive server or Vlaams Supercomputer Centrum. Please also indicate how costs will be covered.
7. Sharing: If you like to discuss solutions to share your large hyperspectral imaging datasets please contact the RDM helpdesk rdm@kuleuven.be
label: good with suggestions
